dcterms:creator: J. Vanschoren
J. N. van Rijn
B. Bischl
L. Torgo
dcterms:description: OpenML is a platform for sharing datasets, machine learning algorithms, and experiments, facilitating collaborative research in machine learning.
dcterms:title: OpenML

dcterms:creator: M. Saerens
P. Latinne
C. Decaestecker
dcterms:description: The Prior Probability Adjuster (PPA) is a method for adjusting the outputs of a classifier to new prior probabilities.
dcterms:title: Prior Probability Adjuster (PPA)

dcterms:creator: A. Storkey
dcterms:description: The Covariate Shift dataset addresses the scenario where the distribution of features changes but the conditional distribution of labels given features remains the same.
dcterms:title: Covariate Shift

dcterms:creator: M. Kull
P. Flach
dcterms:description: The Brier Score is a proper scoring rule used to measure the accuracy of probabilistic predictions.
dcterms:title: Brier Score

dcterms:creator: M. Kull
P. Flach
dcterms:description: Log-Loss, also known as cross-entropy, is a common loss function for evaluating the performance of probabilistic classifiers.
dcterms:title: Log-Loss

dcterms:creator: L. M. Bregman
dcterms:description: Bregman Divergence is a measure of divergence between two points in a convex set, used in various optimization problems.
dcterms:title: Bregman Divergence

dcterms:creator: A. P. Dawid
dcterms:description: Proper Scoring Rules are a class of scoring rules that are minimized by the true probabilities of the outcomes.
dcterms:title: Proper Scoring Rules
